newsitem.title: UK: Soccer star Cantona new screen idol?.
newsitem.headline: Soccer star Cantona new screen idol?.

text.p: Mercurial French soccer star Eric Cantona is to play a French nobleman in his first English-speaking film role.

"This is not a joke piece of casting. He was cast because we think he can act," Tim Bevan, producer of the film "Elizabeth I" about the early life of England's 16th century queen, told Thursday's Daily Telegraph.

Cantona, who won five English league championships with Leeds United and Manchester United, announced his retirement from soccer in May. He was banned from football for nine months in 1995 after aiming a flying kick at a supporter who taunted him.
He made his screen debut in a French comedy. For his latest role he will be playing opposite Lord Attenborough and Geoffrey Rush, Oscar winner for his role in "Shine".
